sentences.english: It is no doubt a pleasure to explore the wonders of nature with children who are so innocent and lovely.
sentences.chinese: 与天真烂漫的儿童一起接触大自然确是赏心乐事。

sentences.english: It used to be said that English people take their pleasures sadly.
sentences.chinese: 人们常说英国人哪怕遇上乐事也还是落落寡欢。
用赏心乐事来弥补厌倦。

sentences.english: Having a chance to enjoy Plushenko's outstanding jumps is a pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 有机会欣赏普鲁申科的突出的跳跃是一件乐事。

sentences.english: One of the joys ofworking on a musical is that you rehearse for two months.
sentences.chinese: 参与歌舞片的一大乐事在于，要彩排两个月。

sentences.english: Hostile journalists at home and abroad enjoyed ridiculing him.
sentences.chinese: 国内外抱有敌意的记者都以嘲弄奚落他为乐事。

sentences.english: Skiing is one of my enjoyments.
sentences.chinese: 滑雪是我的赏心乐事之一。

sentences.english: If there is no" price policy", is not the" pleasure".
sentences.chinese: 如果没有“禁书政策”，是不会产生这种“乐事”的。

sentences.english: One of the pleasures of the world.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，这是人间所能享受的乐事之一。

sentences.english: Working with Jan Lamb and Fama and Miriam was a real pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 与林海峰，农夫一起合作实乃一大乐事。

sentences.english: Undoubtedly he'd seen even less frivolity in his life than we had.
sentences.chinese: 不用说，他一生中所见的乐事比我们的还要少。
旅游是我最大的赏心乐事。

sentences.english: And if these pleasures may thee move.
sentences.chinese: 如果这些赏心乐事能打动你的芳心。

sentences.english: To go to the carnie is a lot of fun for the children.
sentences.chinese: 去游乐场对孩子们来说是一大乐事。

sentences.english: In doing so, you turn the bitterness in satisfaction!
sentences.chinese: 在你这样做时，你就把坏事变成了乐事。

definition: a matter for regret/sth that is a (great) pity
refined activities of the intellectuals (regarding literature, paintings etc)
a matter for regret or resentment
poetic occasion/elegant situation/in literature, the cue for a poem
to spend one's leisure time/to idle away the time
to find amusement in one's own way/to enjoy oneself quietly
to drink together (in company)/to drink together (with food)
anecdote/lost or apocryphal story about famous person
